p: HuNoV belongs to the genus Norovirus of the family Caliciviridae, and it is further genetically classified into three genogroups, GI, GII, and GIV. Genetic analyses have shown that HuNoV GI and GII can be further classified into 9 and 22 genotypes, respectively (Kroneman et al., 2013). Of these, many genotypes have been associated with gastroenteritis outbreaks throughout the world (Hoa Tran et al., 2013). The genomes of noroviruses contain three open reading frames and encodes six non-structural proteins, including the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase and the two capsid proteins VP1 and VP2 (de Graaf et al., 2016).
